author: Anonymous Scale
title: module 2b itemization pt2 video question
question:
Hi, I am a bit confused about the line of code with the red circle on it.
I am not entirely sure why we need the (number? c) to guard against being called on the wrong type of data since "complete" is a string and [1, 10] are integer values, so why would a string be compared against a integer value in the first place?
Or rather I thought the code will only look for an integer value in between or equal 1 and 10, so why would we need to guard against "complete" which is a string?
student_answer: The function runs from up to down. So example if c is a string, and you don't have the guard (number? c), it would produce an error message because it can't compare a string to a number. The function doesn't automatically skip to the next condition because the gets an error.
